title: Homework2
text:
1A) Creating a vector from pre-treatment blood pressure values.

pretreatment <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
pretreatment

 [1] 120 151 125 126 115 132 132 129 134 139 127 122 127 135 133 128 147 138 140
[20] 132


1B) Creating a vector from post-treatment blood pressure values.

posttreatment <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)
posttreatment

 [1] 127 145 135 122 115 122 123 126 126 129 132 146 120 114 121 120 128 120 133
[20] 115



Assigning names to vector elements using the name() and paste() functions


names(pretreatment) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(posttreatment) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")


Calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post-treatment measurements from pre-treatment measurements.


bloodpressure_dif <- pretreatment - posttreatment
bloodpressure_dif

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 



Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure across all patients.


mean_bp_dif <- mean(bloodpressure_dif)
mean_bp_dif

[1] 5.65



Determine which patients experienced a decrease in blood pressure after treatment (a positive change).


positive_change_indices <- which(bloodpressure_dif > 0)
positive_change_indices

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 



Subsetting the vector of differences to only return those that have a positive change.


boolean_postiive_bp <- bloodpressure_dif[bloodpressure_dif > 0]
boolean_postiive_bp

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 



Calculating the average decrease in blood pressure for those where the blood pressure decreased (positive change)


mean_positive_bp_dif <- mean(boolean_postiive_bp)
mean_positive_bp_dif

[1] 10.6






Creating a data frame using previous data


patient <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
df <- data.frame(patient, pre_bp = pretreatment, post_bp = posttreatment, diff_bp = bloodpressure_dif)
df

              patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
Subject_1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
Subject_2   Subject_2    151     145       6
Subject_3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
Subject_4   Subject_4    126     122       4
Subject_5   Subject_5    115     115       0
Subject_6   Subject_6    132     122      10
Subject_7   Subject_7    132     123       9
Subject_8   Subject_8    129     126       3
Subject_9   Subject_9    134     126       8
Subject_10 Subject_10    139     129      10
Subject_11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
Subject_12 Subject_12    122     146     -24
Subject_13 Subject_13    127     120       7
Subject_14 Subject_14    135     114      21
Subject_15 Subject_15    133     121      12
Subject_16 Subject_16    128     120       8
Subject_17 Subject_17    147     128      19
Subject_18 Subject_18    138     120      18
Subject_19 Subject_19    140     133       7
Subject_20 Subject_20    132     115      17



Returning only rows of the data frame where the diff_bp column is negative


df_positive_dif <- df[df$diff_bp > 0, ]
df_positive_dif

              patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
Subject_2   Subject_2    151     145       6
Subject_4   Subject_4    126     122       4
Subject_6   Subject_6    132     122      10
Subject_7   Subject_7    132     123       9
Subject_8   Subject_8    129     126       3
Subject_9   Subject_9    134     126       8
Subject_10 Subject_10    139     129      10
Subject_13 Subject_13    127     120       7
Subject_14 Subject_14    135     114      21
Subject_15 Subject_15    133     121      12
Subject_16 Subject_16    128     120       8
Subject_17 Subject_17    147     128      19
Subject_18 Subject_18    138     120      18
Subject_19 Subject_19    140     133       7
Subject_20 Subject_20    132     115      17



Adding a new column to my data frame orresponding to TRUE if the post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if it is not


df <- df[, -5] #ignore, deleting extra column
df$post_bp_120 <- df$post_bp < 120
df

              patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_bp_120
Subject_1   Subject_1    120     127      -7       FALSE
Subject_2   Subject_2    151     145       6       FALSE
Subject_3   Subject_3    125     135     -10       FALSE
Subject_4   Subject_4    126     122       4       FALSE
Subject_5   Subject_5    115     115       0        TRUE
Subject_6   Subject_6    132     122      10       FALSE
Subject_7   Subject_7    132     123       9       FALSE
Subject_8   Subject_8    129     126       3       FALSE
Subject_9   Subject_9    134     126       8       FALSE
Subject_10 Subject_10    139     129      10       FALSE
Subject_11 Subject_11    127     132      -5       FALSE
Subject_12 Subject_12    122     146     -24       FALSE
Subject_13 Subject_13    127     120       7       FALSE
Subject_14 Subject_14    135     114      21        TRUE
Subject_15 Subject_15    133     121      12       FALSE
Subject_16 Subject_16    128     120       8       FALSE
Subject_17 Subject_17    147     128      19       FALSE
Subject_18 Subject_18    138     120      18       FALSE
Subject_19 Subject_19    140     133       7       FALSE
Subject_20 Subject_20    132     115      17        TRUE

knitr::kable(df)

pre_bp
post_bp
diff_bp

Creating a new data frame with this data similar to task 2.


#Combing values
pre_bp <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
post_bp <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
#Difference between pre_trt and post_trt values
bp_dif <- pre_bp - post_bp
#Defining patient column
patient <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
#Creating a data frame
placebo_df <- data.frame(patient, pre_bp, post_bp, bp_dif)
#Adding new column based on if the post_trt is above 120 or not
placebo_df$post_bp_120 <- placebo_df$post_bp < 120
placebo_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp bp_dif post_bp_120
1   Subject_1    138     105     33        TRUE
2   Subject_2    135     136     -1       FALSE
3   Subject_3    147     123     24       FALSE
4   Subject_4    117     130    -13       FALSE
5   Subject_5    152     134     18       FALSE
6   Subject_6    134     143     -9       FALSE
7   Subject_7    114     135    -21       FALSE
8   Subject_8    121     139    -18       FALSE
9   Subject_9    131     120     11       FALSE
10 Subject_10    130     124      6       FALSE
11 Subject_11    138     105     33        TRUE
12 Subject_12    135     136     -1       FALSE
13 Subject_13    147     123     24       FALSE
14 Subject_14    117     130    -13       FALSE
15 Subject_15    152     134     18       FALSE
16 Subject_16    134     143     -9       FALSE
17 Subject_17    114     135    -21       FALSE
18 Subject_18    121     139    -18       FALSE
19 Subject_19    131     120     11       FALSE
20 Subject_20    130     124      6       FALSE



Creating and storing both data frames in a list


bp_list <- list(treatment = df, placebo = placebo_df)
bp_list

$treatment
              patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_bp_120
Subject_1   Subject_1    120     127      -7       FALSE
Subject_2   Subject_2    151     145       6       FALSE

title: Homework2
text:
1A) Creating a vector from pre-treatment blood pressure values.

pretreatment <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
pretreatment

 [1] 120 151 125 126 115 132 132 129 134 139 127 122 127 135 133 128 147 138 140
[20] 132


1B) Creating a vector from post-treatment blood pressure values.

posttreatment <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)
posttreatment

 [1] 127 145 135 122 115 122 123 126 126 129 132 146 120 114 121 120 128 120 133
[20] 115



Assigning names to vector elements using the name() and paste() functions


names(pretreatment) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(posttreatment) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")


Calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post-treatment measurements from pre-treatment measurements.


bloodpressure_dif <- pretreatment - posttreatment
bloodpressure_dif

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 



Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure across all patients.


mean_bp_dif <- mean(bloodpressure_dif)
mean_bp_dif

[1] 5.65



Determine which patients experienced a decrease in blood pressure after treatment (a positive change).


positive_change_indices <- which(bloodpressure_dif > 0)
positive_change_indices

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 



Subsetting the vector of differences to only return those that have a positive change.


boolean_postiive_bp <- bloodpressure_dif[bloodpressure_dif > 0]
boolean_postiive_bp

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 



Calculating the average decrease in blood pressure for those where the blood pressure decreased (positive change)


mean_positive_bp_dif <- mean(boolean_postiive_bp)
mean_positive_bp_dif

[1] 10.6






Creating a data frame using previous data


patient <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
df <- data.frame(patient, pre_bp = pretreatment, post_bp = posttreatment, diff_bp = bloodpressure_dif)
df

              patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
Subject_1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
Subject_2   Subject_2    151     145       6
Subject_3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
Subject_4   Subject_4    126     122       4
Subject_5   Subject_5    115     115       0
Subject_6   Subject_6    132     122      10
Subject_7   Subject_7    132     123       9
Subject_8   Subject_8    129     126       3
Subject_9   Subject_9    134     126       8
Subject_10 Subject_10    139     129      10
Subject_11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
Subject_12 Subject_12    122     146     -24
Subject_13 Subject_13    127     120       7
Subject_14 Subject_14    135     114      21
Subject_15 Subject_15    133     121      12
Subject_16 Subject_16    128     120       8
Subject_17 Subject_17    147     128      19
Subject_18 Subject_18    138     120      18
Subject_19 Subject_19    140     133       7
Subject_20 Subject_20    132     115      17



Returning only rows of the data frame where the diff_bp column is negative


df_positive_dif <- df[df$diff_bp > 0, ]
df_positive_dif

              patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp

Adding a new column to my data frame orresponding to TRUE if the post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if it is not

df$post_bp_120 <- df$post_bp < 120

Creating a new data frame with this data similar to task 2.


#Combing values
pre_bp <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
post_bp <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
#Difference between pre_trt and post_trt values
bp_dif <- pre_bp - post_bp
#Defining patient column
patient <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
#Creating a data frame
placebo_df <- data.frame(patient, pre_bp, post_bp, bp_dif)
#Adding new column based on if the post_trt is above 120 or not
placebo_df$post_bp_120 <- placebo_df$post_bp < 120
placebo_df

Characterize post-treatment (or placebo) blood pressure measurement as optimal (≤ 120), borderline (120 < bp ≤ 130), and high (> 130)

placebo$status <- character(10)
placebo #checking to see if new data frame "placebo" contains the    appropriate column

title: Homework3
text:
Task 2: Writing Functions

writing a function that adheres to the given guidelines in HW3


#Define the function
calculate_statistics <- function(df_list, stat = "mean") {
  
  # Get the function for the specified statistic
  my_fun <- get(stat)
  
  #List of columns to analyze
  columns <- c("pre_bp", "post_bp", "diff_bp")
  
  #Apply the function to each data frame in the list
  all_stats <- unlist(lapply(names(df_list), function(df_name) {
    df <- df_list[[df_name]]
    
    #Apply the function to each column and store results
    result <- sapply(columns, function(col) {
      if (col %in% names(df)) {
        my_fun(df[[col]], na.rm = TRUE)
      } else {
        NA
      }
    })
    
    #Create meaningful names for the results
    names(result) <- paste(df_name, columns, stat, sep = "_")
    return(result)
  }))
  
  return(all_stats)
}

Applying function to list of data frames!

#Default mean
print(calculate_statistics(bp_list))  

 treatment_pre_bp_mean treatment_post_bp_mean treatment_diff_bp_mean 
                131.60                 125.95                   5.65 
   placebo_pre_bp_mean   placebo_post_bp_mean   placebo_diff_bp_mean 
                131.90                 128.90                   3.00 

#Specifying different statistics
print(calculate_statistics(bp_list, "var"))  

 treatment_pre_bp_var treatment_post_bp_var treatment_diff_bp_var 
             75.72632              78.99737             117.81842 
   placebo_pre_bp_var   placebo_post_bp_var   placebo_diff_bp_var 
            149.87778             124.98889             341.33333 

print(calculate_statistics(bp_list, "sd"))    

 treatment_pre_bp_sd treatment_post_bp_sd treatment_diff_bp_sd 
            8.702087             8.888046            10.854419 
   placebo_pre_bp_sd   placebo_post_bp_sd   placebo_diff_bp_sd 
           12.242458            11.179843            18.475209 

print(calculate_statistics(bp_list, "min"))   

 treatment_pre_bp_min treatment_post_bp_min treatment_diff_bp_min 
                  115                   114                   -24 
   placebo_pre_bp_min   placebo_post_bp_min   placebo_diff_bp_min 
                  114                   105                   -21 

print(calculate_statistics(bp_list, "max"))

 treatment_pre_bp_max treatment_post_bp_max treatment_diff_bp_max 
                  151                   146                    21 
   placebo_pre_bp_max   placebo_post_bp_max   placebo_diff_bp_max 
                  152                   143                    33
